info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 15 at 3:13PM CDT until April 15 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN BENTON COUNTY... At 313 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles southeast of Pea Ridge, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Rogers... Bentonville... Bella Vista... Pea Ridge... Gateway... Miller... Centerton... Avoca... Hill Top... Walnut Hill... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 83 and 93. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
